summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 17873, entitled "An Ordinance granting a permission to Rainier Development Company, its successors and assigns, to lay and maintain in Ninth Avenue North to Denny Way; thence across Denny Way to Bell Street; thence in Bell Street to Fifth Avenue, one or more watermains for the purposes of pumping and carrying water from Lake Union to be used in grading the streets and private property in the Local Improvement District created by Ordinance No. 14993 of the City of Seattle," approved February 4, 1908.
